nodes.text:
You follow the fence line to the guard shack. The structure sits a few degrees off-square, like it gave up on aligning with the world.
The air is quieter here—no keypad chirps, no printer whir—just wind catching on chain-link and the distant, steady hum you can’t unhear.

A porch light is dead. The call box looks newer than the door. The card reader looks newer than the call box.
Everything has been upgraded except the decision to let anyone in.
